result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery J. Clement was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffery J. Clement in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and State states appearances.  Atty Albrecht states recommendations.  Atty Middleton agrees and NC plea entered to 14CF366.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Middleton and DE agree to revocation of DP in 13CT112 and Court finds DE guilty and enters JOC in that case.  Court grants extension of DPA in 13CF122 for one year.  State makes statement.  Atty Middleton makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.
